_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Sir Thopas in the Canterbury Tales — 207 lines in 6-line, tail-rhyme stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Listeneth lordis in good ententand I wil yow telle
                    verament…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…as dide the knyght sir Percyvelleso worthi vnder
                    wede
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
Here Chauncers tellith of Sir Thopas (f. 167v); Chauncers tale
                    (RT); Here oure Ost letteth Chauncers his rymyng (f. 170v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
LEstneth lordes in goode ententAnd I wolle telle
                    verament…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And by hym baiteth his destrerOf herbes fyne and
                    gode

Bod414.First Lines:
[L]isten lordis in good intentAnd I wil telle
                    verament…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…As did the knyght Sir PercyuelleSo wurthy vndir
                    wede

Bod686.First Lines:
Listenneth lordynges in gode ententAnd y wol telle
                    verement…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…As dide þe knyght ser percyvelleSo worthi vnder
                    wedeTyl on a day
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Nexte foloweþ Chaucers tale of Thopas / And here begynneth his tale
                    (f. 170); Here the hoost stynteth Chaucer of his tale of / Thopas and biddeth
                    hym telle a nother tale (f. 172v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Listeth lordes in gode ententI wil you tel
                    verament…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…As did þe knight sere percyuellSo worthely vnder
                    wede
BodHatDon1.Note:
VII.852-4, 918 omitted; 805 left blank; 865 inserted in
                    margin.
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next begynneth the tale / of sire Thopas (f. 187); The Thopas
                    (RT); Here endeth the tale of sir Thopas… (f. 189v)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
LIstneþ lordinges in good ententAnd I wol telle you
                    verement…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…As dide þe knight sir percyvaleSo worþely vnder
                    wede
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…Here begynneþ þe tale of sir Thopas (f. 225v);
                    thopas (RT)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[L]Estneth lordes in goode ententAnd I will telle
                    verrament…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…fful strong hit was of plateAnd over that his cote
                    armure…
BodLauMis739.Note:
Everything after VII.866 lost. Catchphrase on f. 239v:
                    ‘As white is[gutter]’.

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
LVsteneth lordynges in good ententAnd I wol telle
                    verement…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…If ye wol haue more of hitTo telle hit I wol
                    founde
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneth Chaucers tale of syre thopias (f. 95); Chaucer
                    (RT)

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
Listenith lordes in good ententAnd I wil tel
                    verament…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…And be hym baited his desterOf herbes fyne and
                    good
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth Thopias tale (f. 104); thopas (f. 104, margin); the thopas
                    (RT); here endith thopias tale… (f. 105v)

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
Listenith lordinges in good ententAnd I will telle you
                    verralment…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:
…As did the kniȝt Sir PercyuelleSo worthi vnder
                    wode
BodRawPoe223.Attributed Title:
…And here beginneth A tale of Maister Chaucer (f. 180v);
                    Chaucer (RT)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
Lysteneth lordes in good ententAnd I wole telle
                    verrayment…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…As did the knyght sir PercyuelleSo worly vnder wedeTil
                    on a day

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
LEsteneþ lordes in good ententAnd I wol telle
                    verrament…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…And by him bayteþ his destrerOf herbes fyne and
                        goodehimself drank water of þe wellas dide
                        þe knyȝt Sire Percyu[gutter]so worþli
                        vnderwede
OxfCCC198.Note:
VII.805, 915-18 omitted; 915-17 supplied in margin later; blank line
                    follows 774.
OxfCCC198.Attributed Title:
Here bygynneth þe tale of Chaucer of sire Thopas (f. 214);
                            Camxixm (f. 214, margin)
OxfCCC198.Facsimiles:
“Digital
                    Facsimile of Corpus Christi, Oxford MS 198 of the Canterbury
            Tales”  .

OxfNew314.First Lines:
LEsten lordis in good ententAnd I wol telle
                    verament…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:
…As did þe knyȝt ser PercyvelleSo worthili vnder
                    weed
OxfNew314.Attributed Title: Ryme of Ser Topas (f. 208); Sir Thopas (RT)

OxfTri49.First Lines:
Listeneth lordis in gode intenteand I wille telle
                    verament…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…as did sir perciul Perciuelleso worthi vndir
                    wedetill on a day & cetera
OxfTri49.Attributed Title:
Incipit fabula Chauceris de Thopas (f. 198); Chauceris de
                        Thopas (RT); Thopas (RT)

CULDd424.First Lines:
…But he was chast and no lechourAnd sete as is the brambel
                    flourThat bereth the red hepe…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…As ded the knyght Sire PercyuelleSo worthy vnder wedeTil
                    on a day
CULDd424.Note:
VII.712-44 lost. The final line (918) follows 917 in the margin, written
                    as if one line, separated only by a punctus elevatus.

CULGg427.First Lines:
TEstyth lordyngis in good ententAnd I wele tell
                    verrayment…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And forth vp on his weye he glodAs sparkele out of
                    bronde…
CULGg427.Note:
Although the guide letter for the opening initial is an ‘L’,
                    the limner executed a ‘T’. VII.906-18 lost; 805
                    omitted.
CULGg427.Attributed Title: Heere begynnyth Chaucers tale of sere Thopas (f. 323)

CULIi326.First Lines:
Lystenyth lordinges with good ententeAnd I wil you tell
                    verement…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…As did the knyght Sir percevalleSo worthy
                    vnderwede
CULIi326.Note:
VII.719-20, 722, 803, 805, 887, 918 omitted; spurious line follows 806;
                    814-15 reversed.
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth the tale of sir Thopas (f. 187); Chawcers (RT);
                    Here endeth the tale of Sir Thopas (f. 188v)

CULMm25.First Lines:
Listeneth lordynges in goode ententeAnd I woll tell
                    verrramente…
CULMm25.Last Lines:
…As did þe knyȝht sir parywellSo worthily under
                    wede
CULMm25.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe tale of Chaucer be sir thopas (f. 197); Capitulum
                            xixm (f. 197, margin); Sir thopas (RT)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:

CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:

BLEge2863.First Lines:
…Sire thopas wolde out rideHe worthe vpon his stede
                    gray…
BLEge2863.Last Lines:
…And for he was a knyght aunterousHe nolde slepen in none
                    hous…

BLHar1758.First Lines:

BLHar1758.Last Lines:

BLHar7333.First Lines:

BLHar7334.First Lines:

BLRoy17Dxv.First Lines:
Listenyth lordynges in good ententAnd I wil yow telle

BLRoy17Dxv.Last Lines:
…As did the knyȝt sir PercyuelleSo worthy vnder
                    woode
BLRoy17Dxv.Note:
VII.803, 918 omitted.At the foot, in the margin, is ‘finis
                        verte folium’. Two-thirds of the verso is left blank before the
                        explicit.
BLRoy17Dxv.Attributed Title:

                        238v, margin); Here endithe the tale of sir thopas by Chaucer (f.
                        241v)
